caption: Food was great, service was slow, but there was a piece of glass in the bottom of my 5 year old's drink.

Good restaurant. Service was good- our waiter gave us time and didn’t approach too frequently. Made it a more relaxing meal. The portions were a little small but enough to fill me up. The steak frites were great as were the cheese curds. Great presentation of the food and the ambience of the room was perfect.
Food was A M A Z I N G & G R E A,T service
Cocktails and service still earn five stars without a doubt, but I miss some of the classics off the old food menu

Excellent service!! My food took extra long because of an event upstairs. I completely understood then when my steak came out Underdone from what I'd ordered (the couple next to us had gotten their steak mixed up with mine) the bartender Shaun was so easy with fixing it! He was very attentive all night. Absolutely will be back!
Great food in a low-key but classy atmosphere.
Nice staff and ambiance! Went for restaurant week.  @northavedentalcare
I loved the atmosphere and the food was pretty good. Our waitress' blase and superior attitude was a total turn off.
Food was good and the restaurant is right across the street from Wrigley Field
Very nice visit on a busy evening. Reasonable pricing, good cocktails.
Had an amazing Last Word from the bartender
Any selection of bourbon with great food.  Would be 5 stars but $$$$$
Love the atmosphere.
Great food and amazing drinks!
The Old Fashion and Sazerac are on point!
The atmosphere here was absolutely wonderful. Warm and inviting. The staff are professional and always make sure you are satisfied.

The food was AMAZING. Great service with Austin and his team. Get the pot roast if it's available. The west coast oysters also highly recommended.  Great ambience in which you can enjoy small plates as well as entrees with a great craft cocktail. Best place in Wrigleyville that is NOT a sports bar.  Fantastic venue to frequent before a show at Metro.
Always outstanding service. Great vibe. Best Old Fashioned I’ve had in Chicago. A great spot for dinner, or at the very least a stop in for an outstanding nightcap (or two).
Good food and vibe. Limited menu.

Had the opportunity to visit is fine establishment last night. The shrimp cocktail is a must it truly left me wanting for more. I ordered the RIGATONI PUTTANESCA it was so satisfying to my palate but the thing that made my toes curl was the fries and I know it sounds crazy but it was the most delicious fries I’ve ever tasted. They actually belong to my friend who told me I must try.  I actually had to apologize to her because I ate pretty much all her fries🥰
Great
Great cocktails!

It wasn't busy when I went. Granted there wasn't a Cubs game either so that might be why. My friends and I enjoyed the food we ordered (burgers pretty solid) and the cocktails were delicious and well balanced.
I'm a fan. For me,  sufficiently elevated food and drinks at a very reasonable price.
Luv the place!

Unique drinks to amazing out of the box food. Prices are competitive for the area, but the offerings hit a home run! Loved watching the staff work together. Friendly and clean. Hit this newbie hot spot !

My neighborhood place to go. Perfect location with and incredible patio in the second floor (With the best menu ) I like the pesto pasta and the their rotisserie chicken.  My husband really likes the fish and chips.  But the location definitely is just unique.  Great for people watching.  Bar in the second floor is super trendy with a lot of upscale options.  Good wine list.
Having heard good things I was excited to try Mordecai. However, only the yellow watermelon appetizer really impressed us. We had 3 cocktails, 2 entrees and nothing was great.
Mordecai is great, the staff, the cocktails and food are topnotch. Great place to take clients before or after a game or if you just want to step your game up a bit.
Over priced very under expressed
Great cocktails. Delicious fried cheese curds.
Perfect location. Excellent staff. Good food & drink.
Great food!

Cool atmosphere! There Bourbon list is a bit ridiculous in terms of pricing for a 2oz Pour. Great Selection, but more of a museum for whiskey.  Bartender is great.  Small food menu, but the Quality is great!  Maybe come back someday, can't really recommend though!
Nice place
The bartenders are some of the most knowledgeable I've ever been around. I haven't had the food yet (although it looks great, and heard good things about it), but all the drinks are fantastic.
Great cocktails...awesome people!
This place was awesome. The service was great and the food was fantastic.
Stopped in after a concert at the ballpark. First time there and the drinks were strong and the food was fabulous! The server was friendly and fast! Definitely going back!
Mordecai kitchen staff went above and beyond to accommodate my boyfriend and I for our anniversary. Food and service were impeccable!
Outstanding knowledgeable profey staff.  The food and service we're excellent.  The Hanger Steak was cooked to perfection.
Great drinks and food. All kinds of High end bourbons to try. Tom is a killer bartender. Would recommend!!
$$$$ for an just ok food, drinks are very small for the price
Great drinks and the staff was so nice
Great atmosphere, cool decor, and fantastic food.  Combined with professional customer service results in a superior experience
Great little bar on the second floor of hotel Zachary. There's also a nice patio connected with a great view of Wrigley Field.

For as much anticipation as we had this was a complete waste of time. We showed up 10 minutes early for our reservation. We were seated pretty fast. (That’s the only good part.) Sat at our table and waited to order drinks for 15 minutes. We finally ordered only to wait another 41 minutes for our drinks. In the meantime we ordered apps, all of them. The cheese curds came out pretty fast, still waiting for the drinks. Waiter came over and said our drinks will be right up. Waited another 15 minutes and another waiter said our drinks are coming. At this point we decided to get up and leave. We stood up and walked out. No one tried to stop us. They just watched as we walked out the door. Complete waste of time. The menu was expensive and the staff was brutal. Never going here again and making sure when someone asks if I’ve been there to tell them never to visit.
Great food great cocktails
Terrific menu all the way through with excellent drinks. Knowledgeable bar staff.

Beautiful bar. The decor is stunning and it's very chill. It was funny to watch the usual Wrigleyville crowd outside for St Patrick's Day as we were sitting inside a sophisticated place. I love the new Wrigleyville juxtaposition haha!
A very nice upscale place to enjoy with friends

It's aesthetically pleasing. Cute atmosphere and comfortable seating. But the drinks are AWFUL. The draft cocktails are not good. I had to send one back. I do not do this but it was $15. My friend and I each had one--one with vodka, one with gin (even though we both ordered the one with vodka and were brought one of each...). We even tried to switch. No go. The menu is fine. The cheese curds are the highlight...but that's pretty much frozen stuff thrown in a fryer. I ordered Fish n chips and I didn't even get malt vinegar so it tasted like eating cardboard. Even the fries had no taste. I had a bite of the burger my friend ordered--it was tasty. The short ribs were also good, but I was famished. There weren't enough of them. The prices are disproportionate to the sizes of the dishes. The staff are all flighty and I made an opentable reservation and told the host that I was there for my reservation from opentable upon arrival, but they marked me as a no show so I didn't collect my points. WTF.
I was real happy here
Can't speak for the food (yet), but the space is attractive and the drinks quite good.  We will be back to sample the food soon.

We were looking for a respite from the crowds after the game when we were lucky enough to stumble upon this place. We really enjoyed the unique experience. Open and welcoming, yet clean and with an upscale feel. The menu was a bit daring for us but we were all pleased with our selections.

Unfortunately 3 stars is the best I can give this place. My wife and I went and it really only has great ambiance. The service was 3 stars and the price - compared to the food, was too high. For example, the cheese plate they have for dessert is an assortment of 4 hard cheeses. To pay $15 dollars for a chuck of Cheddar is rather underwhelming.
Great service and food

Been to Mordecai five times over the last year and a half and each time seemed to be better than the last. I've never had a bad experience. Quite the opposite, each time I walked away feeling like I had a wonderful experience. The food, the attentive and friendly service (tonight was Kris; thanks Kris), both spot on each and every time.  Tonight, I went with my girlfriend and another couple. It was their first time, and they were blown away. One of them literally "wowed" on the steak and the other one on the chocolate cheesecake. Personally, the sea bass beans and beignets were my favorite.  It's not cheap (though it ranges from a $16 burger to $38 steak), but that's reasonable for the quality of flavor and service. This is a perfect splurge for a special date night or special occasion dinner.

Restaurant week disaster, fat and grits called pork ribs accompanied by a melted ice cream dessert. They tried, but didn’t quite meet the mark of a tasting menu. An abundance of water service but lack of attention beyond water.
The Bar program is on point! Great cocktails
Excellent service. Very good food. Upscale vibe, but still comfortable.

My wife and I are big fans of Mordecai. The NY strip, served with medallions of butter resting on top, is exquisite. The patés are a perfect way to start your meal. What makes Mordecai special for us are Kris and Corbin, who are the custodians of the fine spirits served at Mordecai. If you're looking to explore vintage amari and whiskeys, the price is worth it. I'm a fan of the Bigallet China-China, which Kris introduced to us as a nice digestif to complete the meal.
Absolutely great experience. Kris took very good care of us. Order the chicken! Even the coffee is amazing.

Awesome all around: the atmosphere, with its nod to baseball and classy yet comfortable vibe; the food, expertly crafted versions of familiar favorites; and cocktails, with an excellent selection of whiskey old and new. The passionate bartenders and knowledgeable staff are just as great. Can't wait to go back.
Ask about their black limes😍😍😍
Drinks food service All top notch
Great cocktails right across from Wrigley Field
They make outstanding cocktails
excellent porchetta, pasta and crudites  drinks are good and strong
Great drinks

What a perfect addition to the neighborhood! Great food & the atmosphere is not what you'd expect from that neighborhood. The dishes are unique & what an impressive presentation. The servers and management are very knowledgeable. They have always been very accommodating - stellar service!

Incredible staff. They go above and beyond to make sure that their guests feel taken care of. I couldn't recommend this bar enough based purely on the customer service. Then you get to the food and drinks that are also spectacular.

Mordecai hits it out of the park. Cocktails are inventive and executed with skill. Dishes are surprising and delicious. The service is great, especially considering this place has not been open that long. The locale is ironically perfect.  The secret whiskey/spirits menu is the stuff that makes poets write their verse.  About the only complaint I could muster is that the lock on the bathroom door is sticky - that's how for I'm reaching for something negative.
Great food! I highly recommend the liver mousse, bone marrow and hamachi. Cocktail list was outstanding as well.

The service was outstanding, a bit noisy but you're in Wrigleyville and when the front window is open it's to be expected.  The food was some of the best food I've had for awhile.  A person in our party is very "particular", is in her 90s and forgets things often but our waiter handled her very well.  The grilled octopus was the best I've ever had and the muscles were fantastic.  Overall a great place to grab a great cocktail and some really awesome food.
Great food and drinks. Will be back.
Great drinks, great service, but the space is cold.

I can’t think of a single thing to complain about.  My boyfriend and I went here for dinner on his birthday. The food was outstanding, the service was incredible, the prices were reasonable- I’m hugely impressed! A great addition to the neighborhood. Don’t miss it!
Awesome Food & Service. Was visiting Chicago and stopped after a long day. The food was the delicious and staff very friendly. Can't wait to come back in the future.
Very accommodating staff, great atmosphere and amazing food. A must stop!
Great addition to the neighborhood. The atmosphere, food, cocktails and staff will bring us back.
The food and service was outstanding!
Loved it. Great food. Delightful staff. Overall fabulous time. Essential addition to the neighborhood - can't wait to go back!
$170 for four burgers and 4 beers and the lamest Bloody Mary ever.  Very very limited menu, mediocre food.  Very disappointed and very sad first impression of the Zachary.
Great selection of food and cocktails and can beat location across from Wrigley
Modern, upscale bar right across from Wrigley Field.

Excellent all around - great cocktails, solid service, friendly environment with gorgeous view of Wrigley... but come for the food! Jared Wentworth never disappoints and this is no exception. The whole branzini was amazing
Cocktails are wonderful, friendly attentive staff and one of the best meals I've had in a long time! Came for game day and they had great riffs on ballpark classics. Would totally come again!
